summary: To receive federal funding, state Medicaid programs are supposed to meet federal health care coverage requirements. These include coverage for abortion, but only in cases of rape, incest, or if the woman's life is endangered. We found state-reported practices that did not comply with federal requirements. 1 state did not cover abortion in cases of rape or incest. 14 states did not cover the drug...
title: Medicaid: CMS Action Needed to Ensure Compliance with Abortion Coverage Requirements
